## Useful Info

**Asterion the Fallen King** is an extremely dangerous [unique](/Unique "Unique") [minotaur](/Minotaur_\(monster\) "Minotaur (monster)"), usually generated with a [spectral](/Spectral "Spectral")-branded [demon blade](/Demon_blade "Demon blade"), [demon whip](/Demon_whip "Demon whip"), [demon trident](/Demon_trident "Demon trident"), or [broad axe](/Broad_axe "Broad axe"), as well as a (possibly [magical](/Ego "Ego")) [kite shield](/Kite_shield "Kite shield"). A worshipper of [Makhleb](/Makhleb "Makhleb"), he is capable of launching a variety of powerful elemental attacks against you at range, and he hits astonishingly hard in melee, even before [hasting](/Haste "Haste") himself and summoning a mighty demon to his aid.

## Location

- [The Snake Pit](/The_Snake_Pit "The Snake Pit")
- The [Spider's Nest](/Spider%27s_Nest "Spider's Nest")
- [The Vaults](/The_Vaults "The Vaults"):1-3
- The [Elven Halls](/Elven_Halls "Elven Halls")
- [The Depths](/The_Depths "The Depths"):1-3

## Spells

| :---------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------- |
| Slot1       | [Major Destruction](/Major_Destruction "Major Destruction") (3d27 / 3d24 / 3d6 / 3d25 / 3d22 / 3d20 / 3d28) | [Priest flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |
| Slot2       | [Greater Servant of Makhleb](/Greater_Servant_of_Makhleb "Greater Servant of Makhleb")                      | [Priest flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |
| Slot3       | [Haste](/Haste "Haste")                                                                                     | [Priest flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |

## Tips & Tricks

- His Major Destruction ability allows him to hit you with the following spells: [Bolt of Fire](/Bolt_of_Fire "Bolt of Fire"), [Lightning Bolt](/Lightning_Bolt "Lightning Bolt"), [Sticky Flame](/Sticky_Flame "Sticky Flame"), [Iron Shot](/Iron_Shot "Iron Shot"), [Bolt of Draining](/Bolt_of_Draining "Bolt of Draining"), [Fireball](/Fireball "Fireball"), and [Orb of Electrocution](/Orb_of_Electrocution "Orb of Electrocution"). It's unlikely that you'll have resistance to all of these elements, but even so, it is far better to try to quickly kill him at range than to allow him into melee. With the aid of his [Haste](/Haste "Haste") spell, he can deal extraordinary amounts of damage very quickly, particularly when you consider how early in the game he appears.
- His Greater Servant of Makhleb ability allows him to summon an [executioner](/Executioner "Executioner"), [cacodemon](/Cacodemon "Cacodemon"), [balrug](/Balrug "Balrug"), [blizzard demon](/Blizzard_demon "Blizzard demon"), or [green death](/Green_death "Green death") with a summon cap of one.
- He has sufficient [willpower](/Willpower "Willpower") and [HD](/HD "HD") to make most debilitating effects chancy at best. Dedicated [Hexes](/Hexes "Hexes") specialists might be able to weaken him with [status effects](/Status_effect "Status effect"), but others are unlikely to get much use out of such abilities.
- He is vulnerable to [silver](/Silver "Silver") damage, so ranged weapons users with silver [javelins](/Javelin "Javelin") can deal very heavy damage to him, likely taking him down before he gets close.
- He doesn't need very many turns to kill poorly armoured characters. Err on the side of paranoia when it comes to fleeing a fight before it has a chance to get ugly.

## History

- In [0.30](/0.30 "0.30"), Asterion now always generates with a [spectral](/Spectral "Spectral")-branded weapon.
- Prior to [0.19](/0.19 "0.19"), Asterion had [Spectral Weapon](/Spectral_Weapon "Spectral Weapon") instead of [Greater Servant of Makhleb](/Greater_Servant_of_Makhleb "Greater Servant of Makhleb").
- Prior to [0.17](/0.17 "0.17"), Asterion could appear in the [Swamp](/Swamp "Swamp") or [Shoals](/Shoals "Shoals").
- Asterion was added in [0.14](/0.14 "0.14").

Once a king infamous for waging bloodthirsty campaigns, Asterion was exiled to the depths of the dungeon for his crimes. Here he lurks in his tattered finery, dreaming of a new kingdom. In his lust for power, the minotaur king turned to the worship of Makhleb, and Makhleb has rewarded him with horrifying destructive might.

“The fact is that I am unique. What a man can pass unto others does not interest me; like the philosopher, I think nothing is communicated by the art of writing. Annoying and trivial minutiae have no place in my spirit, a spirit which is receptive only to whatsoever is grand.”
-Jorge Luis Borges, “The House of Asterion”. 1947.
trans. Antonios Sarhanis, 2008.

Contents

  • 1 Useful Info
  • 2 Location
  • 3 Spells
  • 4 Tips & Tricks
  • 5 History

Useful Info

Asterion the Fallen King is an extremely dangerous unique minotaur, usually generated with a spectral-branded demon blade, demon whip, demon trident, or broad axe, as well as a (possibly magical) kite shield. A worshipper of Makhleb, he is capable of launching a variety of powerful elemental attacks against you at range, and he hits astonishingly hard in melee, even before hasting himself and summoning a mighty demon to his aid.

Location

  • The Snake Pit
  • The Spider's Nest
  • The Vaults:1-3
  • The Elven Halls
  • The Depths:1-3

Spells

Spell set I
Slot1 Major Destruction (3d27 / 3d24 / 3d6 / 3d25 / 3d22 / 3d20 / 3d28) Priest flag
Slot2 Greater Servant of Makhleb Priest flag
Slot3 Haste Priest flag

Tips & Tricks

  • His Major Destruction ability allows him to hit you with the following spells: Bolt of Fire, Lightning Bolt, Sticky Flame, Iron Shot, Bolt of Draining, Fireball, and Orb of Electrocution. It's unlikely that you'll have resistance to all of these elements, but even so, it is far better to try to quickly kill him at range than to allow him into melee. With the aid of his Haste spell, he can deal extraordinary amounts of damage very quickly, particularly when you consider how early in the game he appears.
  • His Greater Servant of Makhleb ability allows him to summon an executioner, cacodemon, balrug, blizzard demon, or green death with a summon cap of one.
  • He has sufficient willpower and HD to make most debilitating effects chancy at best. Dedicated Hexes specialists might be able to weaken him with status effects, but others are unlikely to get much use out of such abilities.
  • He is vulnerable to silver damage, so ranged weapons users with silver javelins can deal very heavy damage to him, likely taking him down before he gets close.
  • He doesn't need very many turns to kill poorly armoured characters. Err on the side of paranoia when it comes to fleeing a fight before it has a chance to get ugly.

History

  • In 0.30, Asterion now always generates with a spectral-branded weapon.
  • Prior to 0.19, Asterion had Spectral Weapon instead of Greater Servant of Makhleb.
  • Prior to 0.17, Asterion could appear in the Swamp or Shoals.
  • Asterion was added in 0.14.
